result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time shall be served consecutive to any sentence Defendant is serving.  In the event probation is revoked and prison sentence is imposed, defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program until after the first half of his sentence has been served.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with Brandon Baumhardt. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. 

Defendant shall not enter any establishment or residence known to be associated with drug use, drug dealers, or known drug users.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and/or treatment.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

Outstanding financial obligations in case 14CF299 shall be paid as a condition of probation.  If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information. On a plea to Ct. 2, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1 & 3; No contest plea entered on Ct. 2, Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty on Ct. 2, on motion of the state Court dismisses Ct. 1 & 3 for read in.  Argument from State, Counsel.  Statements from Defendant; Court proceeds to sentencing.
